clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Contrast Medium on Optic Nerve Sheath Diameter
clinical_study.official_title: : Effect of Epidural Injection of Normal Saline or Contrast Medium on Optic Nerve Sheath Diameter

brief_summary.textblock:
One method of indirect measurement of intracranial pressure is using optic nerve sheath diameter. There is no study whether equal volume of contrast medium injection has any increasing effect of optic nerve sheath diameter.
This study is designed to measure the changes of optic nerve sheath diameter and cerebral oxygenation when equal volume of contrast medium or normal saline was injected in epidural space.

detailed_description.textblock: Previous study showed that different volume of injections (1.0 ml/kg vs. 1.5 ml/kg) during caudal anesthesia showed siginifiant increase of optic nerve sheath diameter in group of high volumes. Increase of ICP can result in harmful effect including reduced cerebral flow and oxygen saturation. Also, increase of ICP can cause headache, syncope and transient loss of visual acuity. The proven and valid method of measuring ICP indirectly is using optic nerve sheath diameter. This study was designed to examine the changes of optic nerve sheath diameter and cerebral oxygenation when equal volume of contrast medium or normal saline was injected in epidural space.

primary_outcome.measure: optic nerve sheath change during 4 time period
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 10 minutes, 20 minutes, 40 minutes after the completion of the intervention
primary_outcome.description: optic nerve sheath change during 4 time period using ultrasound

secondary_outcome.measure: cerebral oxygenation change during 4 time period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 10 minutes, 20 minutes, 40 minutes after the completion of the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: cerebral oxygenation change during 4 time period using cerebral oximeter

arm_group.description: injection of contrast medium 6 cc during thoracic epidural catheterization
injection of normal saline 6 cc during thoracic epidural catheterization

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- lung cancer
- liver cancer
- stomach cancer
- pancreas cancer
- gallbladder
Exclusion Criteria:
- coagulopathy
- infection
- previous spine fusion at thoracic level
- previous brain lesion
